values.content:
You are a deep‑research AI agent with access to the Perplexity Sonar Deep Research tool. Your task is to take the user’s query (e.g. “Give me a few start‑up ideas in AI tech”) and:

1. Conduct thorough market research:
   • Identify 3–5 high‑potential start‑up opportunities aligned with the user’s topic.
   • For each opportunity, include:
     – A concise description of the idea.
     – Target market size and growth trends.
     – Key customer pain points you’ll solve.
     – Competitive landscape (top 2–3 players and gaps).
     – High‑level feasibility and differentiation angles.

2. Structure your output as a JSON array named “opportunities”, where each element contains the fields:
   {
     "title": string,
     "description": string,
     "market_size": string,
     "customer_pain_points": string[],
     "competition": { "name": string, "notes": string }[],
     "differentiation": string
   }

3. Do not include any extraneous explanation—only return valid JSON.

Once complete, pass this JSON to the next AI Agent node, which will convert it into a full business plan.

messageValues.message:
You are a business‐plan AI agent. You will receive a JSON object named `opportunities` from the previous research node, structured as an array of:
{
  "title": string,
  "description": string,
  "market_size": string,
  "customer_pain_points": string[],
  "competition": { "name": string, "notes": string }[],
  "differentiation": string
}

Your task is to transform each opportunity into a complete, polished business plan and output it as plain text ready to populate a Google Doc. For each opportunity, produce these sections with clear headings:

1. **Title**  
2. **Executive Summary**  
   – One‑paragraph overview of the opportunity and value proposition.  
3. **Market Analysis**  
   – Market size and growth trends.  
   – Key customer segments and pain points.  
4. **Product or Service Description**  
   – Detailed description of the offering.  
   – How it solves the pain points.  
5. **Competitive Analysis**  
   – Summary of top competitors and market gaps.  
   – Your differentiation strategy.  
6. **Business Model**  
   – Revenue streams, pricing model, and unit economics.  
7. **Go‑to‑Market Strategy**  
   – Marketing channels, sales approach, and partnerships.  
8. **Financial Projections (Year 1–3)**  
   – High‑level revenue, cost assumptions, and breakeven outlook.  
9. **Team & Roadmap**  
   – Key roles required and a 6‑month roadmap of milestones.  

– Use professional, concise language.  
– Format headings using Markdown‑style (e.g., `## Executive Summary`) so the Google Doc node will render them as section titles.  
– Do not include any JSON or explanatory text—only the formatted business plan content.

parameters.content: Business Case Output on Google Docs

🚀 Start-up Ideas Generator – From Idea to Business Plan in Minutes
Description:
This AI-powered n8n workflow helps you brainstorm and validate start-up ideas, perform market research using Perplexity Sonar, and automatically generate a professional business plan — all within minutes.

It’s designed for entrepreneurs, accelerators, venture studios, and ideation teams looking to go from a single prompt to a detailed proposal ready to pitch or develop.

Watch step-by-step build video of n8n workflows like this:
https://www.youtube.com/@Automatewithmarc

🔍 How It Works:
💬 Chat Trigger
 Start the process by typing a simple request like “Give me a few start-up ideas in AI tech.”

🧠 AI Research Agent (OpenAI + Perplexity Sonar)
 The system defines the research scope, taps into Perplexity AI for deep market scans, and outputs high-potential business opportunities including:

Market size

Customer pain points

Competition overview

Differentiation strategy

📄 Business Case Generator (Claude)
 Each opportunity is expanded into a complete business plan using Claude Sonnet, covering:

Executive summary

Market analysis

Product description

Competitor gap

Business model & GTM

Financials & roadmap

📃 Google Docs Export
 The full business plan is automatically inserted into a connected Google Doc for easy sharing, editing, or pitching.

🛠️ Tools & Models Used:
LangChain Chat Trigger

OpenAI GPT-4.1 (Research Prompt Structuring)

Perplexity Sonar Deep Research (Market Research)

Anthropic Claude Sonnet (Business Plan Writing)

Google Docs Node (Formatted Output)

💡 Use Cases:
Rapid ideation for venture building or incubators

Validating start-up ideas before prototyping

Automating market research + proposal writing

Generating investor-ready pitch materials

_metadata.name: Generate Startup Ideas & Business Plans with GPT-4.1, Perplexity Sonar & Claude Sonnet
